intro: Trichogonia pseudocampestris, commonly known as the false cabbage butterfly weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like composite flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Trichogonia pseudocampestris is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
